Learn More About Pacific’s MS Analytics Program

Previous post
Next post

 
 
Tags: Master of Science

The MS in Analytics at Pacific develops students’ technical skills though courses such as Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, and Dynamic Visualization. Students gain hands-on experience and industry connections to become game changers across multiple industries.


TWO CITY EXPOSURE

Whether you prefer the "city of trees" or the urban jungle, Pacific's MS in Analytics now offers its program in Sacramento and San Francisco.  
GET INFORMED

The MS in Analytics at Pacific develops students’ technical skills though courses such as Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, and Dynamic Visualization.  Students gain hands-on experience and industry connections to become game changers across multiple industries.
EXPERIENCE THAT MATTERS
Students take the skills learned in the classroom and apply them to their fourth semester Capstone project. 
This industry-sponsored project is an opportunity to gain professional experience, while working on actual analytics problems.
FLEXIBLE LEARNING 
Crafted to meet the needs of traditional, and working students, this two-year program is conducted with in-class sessions, and out of class webinars.

title: Learn More About Pacific’s MS Analytics Program
content_html:
TWO CITY EXPOSURE

Whether you prefer the "city of trees" or the urban jungle, Pacific's MS in Analytics now offers its program in Sacramento and San Francisco.  
GET INFORMED

The MS in Analytics at Pacific develops students’ technical skills though courses such as Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, and Dynamic Visualization.  Students gain hands-on experience and industry connections to become game changers across multiple industries.
EXPERIENCE THAT MATTERS
Students take the skills learned in the classroom and apply them to their fourth semester Capstone project. 
This industry-sponsored project is an opportunity to gain professional experience, while working on actual analytics problems.
FLEXIBLE LEARNING 
Crafted to meet the needs of traditional, and working students, this two-year program is conducted with in-class sessions, and out of class webinars.
